title: What is the simple probability of the occurrence of an event called? - Quora

response.answer_text: This would be the marginal probability, since this is the only event we are worried about and it is not conditioned on any other event. Joint probabilities are probabilities of multiple events occurring at the same time. Conditional probabilities are probabilities of an event given that another event already occurred. Bayesian probabilities are special conditional probabilities that can be determined from prior probabilities and a flipped conditional probability. For example if you know  and , you can compute the bayesian probability .

Some people might simply call that simple probability by the word odds or the word chances. What are the odds that you'll get two heads when you flip a coin three times? If you throw three dice, what are the chances that at least two of them will be the same?
